content: Since posting my problem I have deleted all my accounts (gmail) from Thunderbird. Closed it . Opened it and re-entered all my accounts. The first one brought up exception sayin google did not have valid certificate!!!!! I granted an exception. Closed thunderbird and reopened it. Downloaded messages and exception request did not come up. So I have achieved a work arround but why does Thunderbird not accept Google certificate? Apple does on my iphone.
creator: auskartdyno

content: Do you mean the Trash Folder? Go to the trash folder and click inside the window that has all the emails listed. Use the keyboard command Ctrl+A which will highlight all the emails. Nit the 'Delete' key on the keyboard. WARNING - once you hit the 'Delete' key, you will not be able to recover any of these emails.
creator: frisée

content:
Do you mean the Trash Folder?

If so, right-click the Trash folder in the folder pane - Empty Trash.
creator: christ1

content: Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings Click on the account you wish to remove on the left. Use the 'Account Actions' drop down at the bottom. Works in 128.5.2esr and 128.6.0esr If there is no option, please send a screenshot of what options you have along with the selection you have made above it.
creator: frisée
